title: Pottery Barn Kids/PB Teen/West Elm/Williams-Sonoma - A Garamond/Clarendon/?/New Century Schoolbook {Patricia, Conor}
content:
I apologize if I am double posting; I posted this a few hours ago and it never appeared. Anyway, I need a batch of logo typefaces identified for a project as none of these appear on brands of the world, so I am stuck recreating them.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pbk-web_6186.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pbt-web_4697.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446im_/http:/typophile.com/files/we-web_4769.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ws-web_4517.jpg)
author: blank

comments.content:
pottery barn = adobe garamond  
PB teen = Clarendon bold  
Williams-Sonoma looks like Century (Schoolbook? ITC? Expanded)

The **west elm** identity looks like [**Interstate** Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/light/) on their website – what you have above is different though (_or_ perhaps I’m looking at the wrong [west elm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446/http:/www.westelm.com/) website).

I’d agree with Patty that **WILLIAMS-SONOMA** does look like [**New Century Schoolbook**](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/new-century-schoolbook/), but it’s weight has me looking at [**Augustea**](http://web.archive.org/web/20150214164446/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/augustea-bq), much of a muchness really.
The _w_, _e_ and _t_ in **west elm** above look remarkably like **Tarzana Narrow** Regular. The remainder, however, are quite different.
